meanings.sent1: The sky mizzled as we walked home from school.
meanings.sent2: I love when it mizzles because it feels refreshing.
meanings.sent3: The mizzling rain made the flowers sparkle like diamonds.
meanings.sent4: The mizzled drops danced on the leaves like tiny fairies.
meanings.sent5: Her garden looked magical under the mizzled sky.

meanings.sent1: The tricky question mizzled me during the test.
meanings.sent2: He tried to mizzle me with his clever words, but I saw through it.
meanings.sent3: The magician's illusions mizzled the audience, leaving them amazed.
meanings.sent4: Her smile mizzled him into thinking everything was fine.
meanings.sent5: The confusing directions mizzled us, and we got lost.

meanings.sent1: She had to mizzle from the party early to catch the last bus.
meanings.sent2: The thief decided to mizzle before anyone noticed the missing items.
meanings.sent3: He had to mizzle out of the meeting to attend an urgent call.
meanings.sent4: The cat suddenly mizzled from the room when the vacuum cleaner started.
meanings.sent5: They planned to mizzle from work early for a surprise celebration.
